reviews.review_msg: I've never met a prof that cares so much about her student's success. She got 3 students in the class published, organized the undergraduate research symposium, and genuinely cares about every student as a person and as a learner. Also, she is HILARIOUS and a great person to be around. Definitely a prof I'm happy I didn't miss out on.
The most boring class with zero learning. Didn't feel engaged in class at all. There are not many options at SFU but do a favour to yourself and choose someone else.

If you participate in class and do your assigned readings on time, you will be fine in this course. There is two reflection papers, a group presentation, a group portfolio, and online weekly discussions. He made the classes more interactive as we did group discussions and debates. As long as you follow guidelines, you will be graded quite fairly.
His marking scale is a bit unfair. 90% is an A- , vastly different than anything Ive had before. His lectures are not relevant to the major project

She is SO unorganized, unfair, and prejudiced.  She was condescending to certain students.  Marking scheme was very unevenly weighted, although this is an extremely easy class I do not recommend it.  If you have taken 220 (who I took with Sugarman, and he was wonderful) this class is a complete waste of time.

This course is easy - all exam and paper questions from the textbook. Read and pass. Good teacher - clear, available and fair. Only bad - focus on final paper with outline and drafts. Not a good choice for exam fans.
This class a must for education program. She knows her stuff and is very helpful with questions in class and on email.

Good range of topics. Interesting presentations in class - TEDtalks and discussions good start to class material. Different types of assignments. Lots of rewrite opportunities. Always available by email.
Good interest course - clear and on topic.

Course was hard because textbook was online and not very accessible at first(prof fixed access by week 3). However, class website had all the assignments, readings, and and rubrics, which organized info and made deadlines clear. Excellent prep for those in Education and PDP.

Seemed to have bias towards science students, in particular. Lectures are actually forced discussions, so be prepared when you come to class. Assignments are easy and lates are generally permitted. Her marking is fair and if you disagree, she is willing to hear you out.

She is VERY unorganized and gets flustered due to her lack of course structure. Is somewhat patronizing to some students.  Course is marked  unfairly, majority is based on chapter summaries and the ten page paper is only worth 15% (10% just for completing the draft).  Classes are all discussions, no teaching.  Did not get anything out of this class

Nice person, you can tell she knows alot about the field. HOWEVER! She is super unorganized, does not give you any clue as to what is expected for papers/projects. No rubric/guidelines. When I asked for help she didn't really answer my questions. 65% of grade is based on reading the chapters. Waste of time. Take a different educ clas. Not worth it!

She is a pretty nice person, but not really a great professor. She gives unclear criteria for assignments, she barely does actual teaching, gives almost no feedback, and there is so. much. group. work. This class is tough to get through. That said, I do appreciate her as a person.
Those who can, do. Those who can't, teach. Those who can't teach, are education professors.

Course based on group project n few ind asgn. class half inperson/online. Daniel tries his best to engage you w content. no TB but tons of long readings (just know concept n purpose n you'll be fine). project is making a 3day course n present to class. very flexible in what n how you are taught n get to express your learning in a reasonable way.
